name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions:
1. Cook pasta in salted boiling water until al dente.
2. While pasta cooks, fry pancetta until crispy.
3. Beat eggs with grated cheese and black pepper.
4. Drain pasta (reserve some pasta water).
5. Remove pan from heat, add pasta to pancetta.
6. Quickly mix in egg mixture, adding pasta water to create creamy sauce.
7. Serve immediately with extra cheese and pepper.

name: Chickpea Curry
instructions:
1. Sauté onion and garlic until soft.
2. Add curry powder and cook for 1 minute.
3. Add tomatoes and coconut milk, simmer 10 minutes.
4. Add chickpeas and cook 15 minutes.
5. Stir in spinach until wilted.
6. Serve over rice.

name: Greek Salad
instructions:
1. Chop all vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
2. Combine in a large bowl.
3. Add olives and crumbled feta.
4. Dress with olive oil, vinegar, and oregano.
5. Toss gently and serve.

name: Beef Bourguignon
instructions:
1. Brown beef in batches, set aside.
2. Cook bacon, then vegetables.
3. Return beef to pot, dust with flour.
4. Add wine and stock, bring to simmer.
5. Cover and cook in 325°F oven for 2.5 hours.
6. Add mushrooms in last 30 minutes.
7. Serve with crusty bread or mashed potatoes.

name: Avocado Toast
instructions:
1. Toast bread until golden.
2. Mash avocado with lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
3. Spread on toast.
4. Top with red pepper flakes.
5. Add poached egg if desired.

name: Pad Thai
instructions:
1. Soak rice noodles in warm water for 30 minutes.
2. Mix tamarind, fish sauce, and sugar for sauce.
3. Stir-fry protein until cooked, set aside.
4. Scramble eggs in wok, add drained noodles.
5. Add sauce and protein, toss well.
6. Serve with bean sprouts, peanuts, and lime.

name: Vegetable Stir Fry
ingredients: Mixed vegetables (broccoli, bell peppers, carrots, snap peas)
instructions:
1. Prep all vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
2. Heat oil in wok over high heat.
3. Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry 30 seconds.
4. Add harder vegetables first (carrots, broccoli).
5. Add softer vegetables, stir-fry 3-4 minutes.
6. Add soy sauce and sesame oil.
7. Serve over rice.
